alert.note: Alert for Coconino (Arizona) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Flash Flood Warning issued May 16 at 10:39PM MST until May 17 at 7:45AM MST by NWS Flagstaff
info.description: The National Weather Service in Flagstaff has extended the * Flash Flood Warning for... Cataract Creek in Coconino County... * Until 745 AM MST Wednesday /845 AM MDT Wednesday/. * At 1036 PM MST, Heavy rain that fell in the headwaters of Cataract Creek likely continues to send a flood wave down toward Supai. The gauge at Cataract Creek measured a nearly 2 foot rise in an hour early Tuesday evening. HAZARD...Life-threatening flash flooding. SOURCE...Radar. IMPACT...Life-threatening flash flooding of low-water crossings, creeks, normally dry washes and roads. * Some locations that will experience flash flooding include... Grand Canyon National Park, Supai and Havasupai Reservation. This includes the following swimming holes... All swimming holes on Havasu Creek near Supai. This includes the following creeks, washes and rivers... Havasu Creek, Pasture Wash, Colorado River and Little Coyote Canyon. FLASH FLOOD...RADAR INDICATED FLASH FLOOD DAMAGE THREAT...CONSIDERABLE
info.instruction: Turn around, don`t drown when encountering flooded roads. Most flood deaths occur in vehicles. Be especially cautious at night when it is harder to recognize the dangers of flooding. Remain alert for flooding even in locations not receiving rain. Normally dry washes, slot canyons and creeks can become raging killer currents in a matter of minutes, even from distant rainfall.
